extendedInfo.description: This unique application is for all students across the world. It covers 118 topics of Theory Of Machines II in detail. These 118 topics are divided in 4 units.Each topic is around 600 words and is complete with diagrams, equations and other forms of graphical representations along with simple text explaining the concept in detail.This USP of this application is "ultra-portability". Students can access the content on-the-go from anywhere they like.Basically, each topic is like a detailed flash card and will make the lives of students simpler and easier.Some of topics Covered in this application are:1.	GYROSCOPIC MOTION2.	PROCESSIONAL ANGULAR MOTION3.	GYROSCOPIC COUPLE4.	EFFECT OF THE GYROSCOPIC COUPLE ON AN AERO PLANE5.	TERMS USED IN A NAVAL SHIP6.	EFFECT OF GYROSCOPIC COUPLE ON A NAVAL SHIP DURING STEERING7.	EFFECT OF GYROSCOPIC COUPLE ON A NAVAL SHIP DURING PITCHING8.	EFFECT OF GYROSCOPIC COUPLE ON A NAVAL SHIP DURING ROLLING9.	EFFECT OF THE GYROSCOPIC COUPLE AND CENTRIFUGAL COUPLE10.	STABILITY OF A TWO WHEEL VEHICLE TAKING A TURN (EFFECT OF GYROSCOPIC COUPLE)11.	STABILITY OF A TWO WHEEL VEHICLE TAKING A TURN (EFFECT OF CENTRIFUGAL COUPLE)12.	INERTIA FORCES IN RECIPROCATING PARTS13.	APPROXIMATE ANALYTICAL METHOD FOR VELOCITY OF THE PISTON14.	APPROXIMATE ANALYTICAL METHOD FOR ACCELERATION OF THE PISTON15.	FORCES ON THE RECIPROCATING PARTS OF AN ENGINE (PISTON EFFORT)16.	FORCES ON THE RECIPROCATING PARTS OF AN ENGINE (CONNECTING ROD)17.	EQUIVALENT DYNAMICAL SYSTEM18.	FORCES ON THE RECIPROCATING PARTS OF AN ENGINE (CRANK SHAFT)19.	TURNING MOMENT DIAGRAM20.	TURNING MOMENT DIAGRAM FOR A INTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINE21.	FLUCTUATION OF ENERGY22.	DETERMINATION OF MAXIMUM FLUCTUATION OF ENERGY23.	COEFFICIENT OF FLUCTUATION OF ENERGY24.	FLYWHEEL25.	COEFFICIENT OF FLUCTUATION OF SPEED26.	FLYWHEEL IN PUNCHING PRESS27.	DIMENSIONS OF THE FLYWHEEL RIM28.	ENERGY STORED IN A FLYWHEEL29.	GOVERNORS INTRODUCTION30.	TYPES OF GOVERNORS31.	CENTRIFUGAL GOVERNORS32.	WATT GOVERNOR33.	PROELL GOVERNOR34.	HARTNELL GOVERNOR35.	HARTUNG GOVERNOR36.	WILSON-HARTNELL GOVERNOR37.	PICKERING GOVERNOR38.	SENSITIVENESS OF GOVERNORS39.	STABILITY OF GOVERNORS40.	HUNTING41.	EFFORT AND POWER OF A GOVERNOR42.	CONTROLLING FORCE43.	CONTROLLING FORCE DIAGRAM FOR PORTER GOVERNOR44.	CONTROLLING FORCE DIAGRAM FOR SPRING-CONTROLLED GOVERNORS45.	COEFFICIENT OF INSENSITIVENESS46.	BRAKES47.	TYPES OF BRAKES48.	SINGLE BLOCK OR SHOE BRAKE49.	PIVOTED BLOCK OR SHOE BRAKE50.	DYNAMOMETER51.	PRONY BRAKE DYNAMOMETER52.	ROPE BRAKE DYNAMOMETER53.	TORSION DYNAMOMETER54.	BEVIS-GIBSON FLASH LIGHT TORSION DYNAMOMETER55.	CAMS56.	CLASSIFICATION OF FOLLOWERS57.	TERMS USED IN RADIAL CAMS58.	MOTION OF THE FOLLOWER59.	BALANCING OF A SINGLE ROTATING MASS BY A SINGLE MASS ROTATING IN THE SAME PLANE60.	BALANCING OF A SINGLE ROTATING MASS BY TWO MASSES ROTATING IN DIFFERENT PLANES61.	PLANE OF THE DISTURBING MASS LIES IN BETWEEN THE PLANES62.	THE PLANE OF THE DISTURBING MASS LIES ON ONE END OF THE PLANES63.	BALANCING OF SEVERAL MASSES ROTATING IN THE SAME PLANE (ANALYTICAL METHOD)64.	BALANCING OF SEVERAL MASSES ROTATING IN THE SAME PLANE (GRAPHICAL METHOD)65.	BALANCING OF SEVERAL MASSES ROTATING IN THE SAME PLANE (SOLVED EXAMPLE)66.	BALANCING OF SEVERAL MASSES ROTATING IN DIFFERENT PLANES67.	ROTATION OF MASSES IN DIFFERENT PLANE GRAPHICALY68.	BALANCING OF RECIPROCATING MASSES69.	PRIMARY AND SECONDARY UNBALANCED FORCES OF RECIPROCATING MASSES70.	PARTIAL BALANCING OF UNBALANCED PRIMARY FORCE IN A RECIPROCATING ENGINE71.	PARTIAL BALANCING OF LOCOMOTIVES72.	VARIATION OF TRACTIVE FORCE73.	SWAYING COUPLE74.	HAMMER BLOW75.	BALANCING OF PRIMARY FORCES OF MULTI-CYLINDER IN-LINE ENGINES76.	MECHANICAL VIBRATION77.	TYPES OF VIBRATORY MOTION78.	TYPES OF FREE VIBRATIONS79.	NATURAL FREQUENCY OF FREE LONGITUDINAL VIBRATIONS (EQUILIBRIUM METHOD)All topics are not listed because of character limitations set by the Play Store.
